sentences.sContent: This is actually just a microorganism. But it has roughly 500 genes.
sentences.sContent_eng: This is actually just a microorganism. But it has roughly 500 genes.
sentences.sCn: 这其实只不过是一个微生物，却拥有约500个基因。

sentences.sContent: Spread the contents of the amber onto a petri dish containing a microorganism food like starch or soy.
sentences.sContent_eng: Spread the contents of the amber onto a petri dish containing a microorganism food like starch or soy.
sentences.sCn: 把琥珀内嵌标本放在皮氏培养皿中，并加入微生物食品，比如淀粉或大豆。

sentences.sContent: Slight mutations that allow a microorganism to resist the full killing power of a medicine are an evolutionary advantage that greatly expedites the development of drug resistance.
sentences.sContent_eng: Slight mutations that allow a microorganism to resist the full killing power of a medicine are an evolutionary advantage that greatly expedites the development of drug resistance.
sentences.sCn: 略微的突变即可使微生物具有抵抗力，使药物完全失去杀伤力，这种突变是一个进化优势，大大加快了耐药性的产生。

phrases.pCn: 病原微生物；致病微生物

remMethod.val: micro(微小的) + organism(生物) → 微生物

trans.tranOther: a living thing that is so small that it cannot be seen without a  microscope
